definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
meticulous/(of domestic animals or fowls) young

sentences.english: Fume smell filled shed filled with a tiring day laborer.
sentences.chinese: 油煙味充斥的小棚裏坐滿了勞累一天的打工仔。

sentences.english: She from an ordinary wage earners to grow fruit and vegetable shop in my head.
sentences.chinese: 她從一名普通的打工仔成長爲我店果菜組長。

sentences.english: Resemble me such pedagogic young worker, want to buy easier said than done of a house.
sentences.chinese: 像我這樣的教師打工仔，要買一套房子談何輕易。

sentences.english: The workers in the south often go to work early and leave off late.
sentences.chinese: 南下打工仔經常是早上工，晚下班。

sentences.english: And many of them are confined to work in factories.
sentences.chinese: 但他們中許多人僅限於在工廠做一個打工仔。

definition: to make a hard living as unskilled laborer
(coll.) adults still living with and depending on their parents
those who did not benefit from the Chinese economic reforms of the 1980s/see also 富二代[fu4 er4 dai4]
lit. moonlight group/fig. those who spend their monthly income even before they earn their next salary (slang)
to work a temporary or casual job/(of students) to have a job outside of class time, or during vacation
to do odd jobs/to do unskilled work
to support one's family (idiom); to have difficulty feeding a family
